metadata.title: CVE-2019-11727 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability exists where it possible to force Network Security Services(NSS) to sign CertificateVerify with PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures when those arethe only ones advertised by server in CertificateRequest in TLS 1.3. PKCS#1v1.5 signatures should not be used for TLS 1.3 messages. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 68.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
